contentencoded: There's potential for a state of emergency in Ukraine this morning, where protesters are taking over government buildings. The protests began after President Viktor Yanukovych decided to align Ukraine's trade relationship with Russia, instead of the European Union. Ukraine also owes Russia billions of dollars for natural gas. Click the audio player above to hear the BBC's David Stern tell Marketplace's Lizzie O'Leary about the economic underpinning of the civil unrest in Ukraine.
title: The economics behind Ukraine's unrest
contenttemplated:

teaser: Ukraine's trade relationship with Russia is at the root of the mass protests there.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, January 27, 2014
description: Ukraine's trade relationship with Russia is at the root of the mass protests there.
